Purpura ('''[[Purpura/ecchymosis/hematoma SD-089|purpura/ecchymosis/hematoma]]''')

* red or purplish skin lesions
* separated by an interval of healthy skin
* do not disappear with vitro-pressure
* associated with extravasation of blood into the dermis
* variable in appearance: punctiform, "pinhead" (petechial purpura), in the form of linear streaks (vibices) or larger lesions (ecchymotic purpura).

properties.question: How is purpura characterized in terms of skin lesions?
properties.option_a: Red or purplish skin lesions that disappear with applied pressure
properties.option_b: White or yellow skin lesions that are separated by an interval of healthy skin
properties.option_c: Red or purplish skin lesions that do not disappear with applied pressure
properties.option_d: Blue or green skin lesions that are always associated with extravasation of blood into the dermis
